str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To reconcile, change from one state of feeling to another. From apo and katallasso; to reconcile fully.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Blameless, without blemish, unblemished, faultless. Unblemished.
Before the face of, over against. From kata and enopion; directly in front of.
